newsitem.title: USA: Clinton nominates Democrat and Republican for FCC.
newsitem.headline: Clinton nominates Democrat and Republican for FCC.

text.p: President Clinton has nominated a Democrat and a Republican to fill two vacancies at the five member Federal Communications Commission, government officials said Friday.

The White House has yet to officially announce the nominations of Democrat William Kennard and Republican Harold Furchtgott-Roth. But the Clinton administration has forwarded the names to the Senate, which must confirm the nominees, the government officials said.
Kennard, 40, is currently the FCC's general counsel, a post he has held since December 1993.

Under his stewardship, the FCC has been winning more than 80 percent of its cases before the U.S. appeals court in Washington. That's up from a bit under 60 percent before Kennard became general counsel.
Previously, Kennard was a partner and member of the board of directors of the Washington law firm of Verner, Liipfert, Bernhard, McPherson and Hand. He specialized in communications law.
